data.title: Want a Real Submarine?
data.text: Are you tired of the anemic so called "Italian Style" sandwiches offered by the chains and markets? Generic and tasteless, they just don't have what it takes to get it right. I crave an authentic Submarine (Grinder, Hero, Hoagie). One made with real ham and salami. Add provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato and put it on a really good roll. But now you come to the critical point that's going to make or break you - the dressing. This is where Santino's shines and they've been doing it the same way through changes in ownership for what seems like forever. They give you a few potato chips a good pickle and a some peppers, too. There's a full bar but I like to wash my Sub down with just a cold beer. Supermarkets and chains? Fuhgetaboutit!

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: The pizza dough is hand made there and therefore the pizzas are delicious. The atmosphere is great and welcoming to children of all ages. The service is great and the staff is very friendly.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: We ordered a pizza, wings and potato wedges the other day.  We were bummed that it was before 5 pm because we wanted it delivered, but that is the way it goes. The pizza was fresh and even good the next day cold.  We will come back!!!

data.title: Grood time for a great pizza
data.text: Stopped in for a pizza and have gone back now at least 8 times. The pizzas are great, they are never stingy on the toppings, staff are friendly, a great place for kids, with a game room, and a large bar for the grown-ups.

data.title: The very best pizza in Ventura
data.text: Santino's is a Ventura institution. The pizza is prepared with a thin crust, my favorite, and a very good sauce. Toppings are generous, fresh and delicious. Delivery is available and is prompt. Highly recommended... Individual pizzas are great for lunch. Good salad bar.

data.title: Been eating pizza here a long time!
data.text: One of my favorite pizza eateries in Ventura. My family and I have enjoyed their pizza sense it opened many years ago. The pizza is always good and the service is great. Their are actually two sections here. One is more for families and the other has a nice bar and tables with TV viewing. A family can eat on either side, it's up to you to choose? There is also a small banquet room and gaming area for the kids. The pizza is very good and they also have a nice salad bar. This place is just right for us and I've been to several retirement and special occasion parties held in the banquet room. A nice family place.

data.title: Good pizza!
data.text: I really enjoyed the food here. I came here for lunch with a few people during our lunch break because it was close to work. We ordered 2 pizzas which were both great! They came out really fast. It also included the salad bar but only one trip :(. However, for the most part, it was a great food with great company and we all enjoyed it! I would come back here for a quick lunch again.

data.title: How can you screw up a Pizza..???
data.text: and this place does it well.  My work colleague had a craving for Pizza and suggested I locate a place in Ventura.  We didn't want a chain like Pizza Hut or Shakies, so I decided on Santino's. We sat at the bar, along with a couple of dozen sports fans watching the LA Dodgers victory over Atlanta. We ordered the Santino Special. It came to the table about 20 minutes later. Their thick  Crust wasn't anything special and meat seem like it had been frozen. The Pizza was eatable, since we were both hungry, but was over priced for being so (we ordered a medium) small and disappointing. It was very bland and with more crust and very little sauce....Not recommended.

data.title: A favorite who recently disappointed me
data.text: I've visited Ventura since I was a child for over 25 years. I've always loved Santinos and it is tradition for me to go there one of the first nights in town. Normally I'd give them all 4 or 4 stars, this time the pizza was great, but service bombed. We ordered two pizzas for carry out - one was a Hawaiian style. When we got it home, it was just Canadian bacon, lacking the pineapple. So we called back and they offered to deliver the correct pizza which was great and the right thing to do - but then they tell us they will need to pick up the incorrect pizza?  What in the world is that about?  Well having to wait another 35 minutes, I allowed my son to eat two slices as he was hungry from the flight. I think the request to pick up the other pizza was ridiculous and made us feel like they didn't trust us. Also, we were inconvenienced and they did nothing to make it feel right. Oh well, I'd still go back but a customer service error for sure. Love their pizzas and especially the crust.

data.title: Home of the best pizza in town!
data.text: Santinos makes a great quality pizza! No cheap, $5 pizza here folks. Real cheese, real meats, and delicious, hot out of the oven food keeps me coming back each time I visit home!

data.title: Mamma Mia whatta pizza!
data.text:
There are a lot of pizza places in Ventura, but there is only one Santino's.  When you walk in the door the smell of luscious herbs and spices fill your mind with thoughts of old Italy.  You can sit in the restaurant or bar and they will bring your hot, delicious pizza to you on a pedestal (no kidding).  

The meats, cheeses, and crust are all fresh; you can taste that in every bite!  Often crusts on pizzas from other places are inedible but that is no problem at Santino's, you can believe you ate the whole thing! 

The restaurant is very family friendly and they offer specials for those who bring the entire family.  

No wonder they have been here for over 28 years (that I know of).

data.title: Great Pizza but Pricey
data.text: Lots of cheese on the pizza but you pay for it.  Great taste and a average atmosphere.  Nothing fancy except the dish the pizza is served on.  Tall standing dish....but don't forget the pepercinni's.  Their yummy with Pizza.

data.title: Big screens and Pizza!!
data.text: Sports? Pizza? Salad Bar??  OK, it's dark in the bar,  but hold it down the game is on!! I'm there during the big games.

data.title: More than just great Pizza !
data.text:
I was there a couple of times ( 1 for the USC / Oregon college football game .... way to go Trojans ) and had their meatball sandwich and the famous lasagna. I have to give you a word of caution : if you are allergic to cheese... do not go there. It seems that they love to use that good stuff on about anything that comes out of the kitchen !
They also have a great salad bar with lots of fresh vegetables. My cheapskate friends love to go for their happy hours and munch on chicken wings and wash it down with a bucket of beers. Service is always very friendly and efficient.
Just a great place to hang out with friends and family !

data.title: Owners were RUDE!
data.text:
The pizza was ok, the place was packed and loud and the service was friendly but slow.  Teams have been going there for years because if they wear their jerseys they eat for free-or something like that!  
The woman owner needs to retire or take a brush up course in customer service.  She was angry and rude to me and my daughter in front of my grandson's team and the entire restaurant.  I was humiliated.  I will never go there again and think the teams should find a new place to celebrate!

data.title: Best pizza in California--locals love this place
data.text: I used to live in Ventura and enjoyed Santino's pizza for years.  Every visit back, I try to go there and am delighted that it's still a wonderful pizza place.  I can't recommend it enough!
